availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Sinclair Wyatt (Montgomery County, Kentucky, clerk, farmer, and sheriff)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, clerk, farmer, and sheriff. Montgomery County, Kentucky, native. Son of Hayden Wyatt and Mary Wyatt. Married to Elizabeth "Bettie" Orear Wyatt in Montgomery County, Kentucky, on February 20, 1855. Father of L. Buford Wyatt, John S. Wyatt, Albert Wyatt, and Mary G. Wyatt. Clerk in Montgomery County in 1850. Household owned six enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1850. Sheriff in Montgomery County from 1856 to 1864. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Montgomery County in 1860. Member of Chapel Methodist Episcopal Church.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 2, p. 57.

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Jeffersonville, p. 260A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Montgomery County Marriages, Film #000216835.
